headline: Mexico antitrust regulator blocks Visa bid for Prosa stake
summary: The deal would have shifted competition, leaving Visa with two of Mexico’s three card brands via Visa and Prosa’s Carnet.

content.title: Mexico antitrust regulator blocks Visa bid for Prosa stake
content.summary: The deal would have shifted competition, leaving Visa with two of Mexico’s three card brands via Visa and Prosa’s Carnet.

thumbnail.caption: Visa signed deal to acquire majority stake in Prosa in December 2023. Credit: Allmy/ Shutterstock.com.

headline: Formula One Group (FWON.K) Is Up 5.5% After RB Team Sale Highlights F1 Franchise Valuations
summary: Liberty Media’s Formula One Group tracking stock came back into focus after its latest earnings report and news of a pending sale of the Visa Cash App RB team at a substantial valuation, which together highlighted how investors are reassessing the business drivers behind the sport. The prospective RB team sale underlines how F1 franchises are being treated as global media and entertainment assets, sharpening attention on future race-fee growth, media rights negotiations, and sponsorship...

headline: Dystopian AI report sinks DoorDash, software stocks
summary: Investing.com -- DoorDash shares fell 7% on Monday, while Uber dropped 3%, Salesforce declined 4%, MongoDB slid 6%, and ServiceNow lost 4%, following publication of a dystopian scenario analysis from Citirini Research examining potential risks from rapid AI advancement. Visa and Mastercard also declined, falling over 2%.

content.title: Dystopian AI report sinks DoorDash, software stocks

Visa and Mastercard also declined, falling over 2%.

headline: The Viral Citrini Substack Post That's Sparking New AI Worries on Wall Street
summary: Is AI bullish for the economy, or bearish? Maybe it's so bullish that it becomes bearish. That's the conceit of a viral Substack post from Citrini Research painting a dark portrait of a future scenario in which AI inspires a race to the bottom in white-collar knowledge work.

content.title: The Viral Citrini Substack Post That's Sparking New AI Worries on Wall Street
content.summary: Is AI bullish for the economy, or bearish? Maybe it's so bullish that it becomes bearish. That's the conceit of a viral Substack post from Citrini Research painting a dark portrait of a future scenario in which AI inspires a race to the bottom in white-collar knowledge work.

headline: Software, Payments Shares Tumble After Citrini Post on AI Risks
summary: DoorDash Inc., American Express Co. and Blackstone Inc all slumped more than 7%.  Shares of other companies name-checked in the article, including Uber Technologies Inc., Mastercard Inc., Visa Inc, Capital One Financial Corp., Apollo Global Management Inc. and KKR & Co. Inc. were all lower by at least 3%.

Inc. were all lower by at least 3%.

headline: Is HODLing killing bitcoin adoption?
summary: GoMining CEO, Mark Zalan, joined CoinDesk Live at Consensus Hong Kong to challenge bitcoin's "digital gold" narrative. Zalan explains why Bitcoin must evolve from a stagnant investment into a functional currency to achieve true mass adoption. He breaks down the infrastructure hurdles preventing everyday spending and how GoMining’s 2026 rollout of new payment rails aims to outperform legacy giants like Visa and MasterCard.

content.title: Is HODLing killing bitcoin adoption?

He breaks down the infrastructure hurdles preventing everyday spending and how GoMining’s 2026 rollout of new payment rails aims to outperform legacy giants like Visa and MasterCard.

headline: A Viral Blog Post Slams Stocks. Fear About AI Is Real.
summary: The Substack post envisions an economy in 2028 in which AI has triggered mass layoffs and disrupted large-cap stocks like DoorDash and Uber.

content.title: A Viral Blog Post Slams Stocks. Fear About AI Is Real.
content.summary: The Substack post envisions an economy in 2028 in which AI has triggered mass layoffs and disrupted large-cap stocks like DoorDash and Uber.

headline: Financial Stocks Take a Hit With AI Worries on Investors’ Minds
summary: Shares in big banks and other financial services firms took a hit on Monday with investors parsing through the possible impacts of artificial intelligence on the payment processing fees that bring in billions of dollars to the industry every year.  American Express’ stock was down over 7% as of Monday afternoon while JPMorgan, Citigroup and Morgan Stanley were all down 4% or more.  Investors were particularly focused on a report from Citrini Research that predicted an economic calamity based on the widespread proliferation of artificial intelligence into the economy.

content.title: Financial Stocks Take a Hit With AI Worries on Investors’ Minds
content.summary: Shares in big banks and other financial services firms took a hit on Monday with investors parsing through the possible impacts of artificial intelligence on the payment processing fees that bring in billions of dollars to the industry every year.  American Express’ stock was down over 7% as of Monday afternoon while JPMorgan, Citigroup and Morgan Stanley were all down 4% or more.  Investors were particularly focused on a report from Citrini Research that predicted an economic calamity based on the widespread proliferation of artificial intelligence into the economy.

headline: Mexico Regulators Slam the Brakes on Visa's Prosa Acquisition
summary: V's bid to buy 51% of Mexico's Prosa was blocked by regulators, citing competition and data concerns, adding to global scrutiny worldwide.

content.title: Mexico Regulators Slam the Brakes on Visa's Prosa Acquisition
